alert.note: Alert for Fulton; Kosciusko; Marshall; Pulaski; Starke (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 06 at 9:47AM EST until March 10 at 1:00PM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana... Wabash River near Linn Grove affecting Adams and Wells Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Tippecanoe River above Winamac affecting Carroll, Pulaski and White Counties. Tippecanoe River near Ora affecting Fulton IN, Starke, Pulaski, Kosciusko and Marshall Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tippecanoe River near Ora. * WHEN...Until early Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Flooding begins to affect streets and homes in Monterey. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM EST Monday /7:45 AM CST Monday/ the stage was 12.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 AM EST Monday /7:45 AM CST Monday/ was 12.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 12.8 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Never drive vehicles through flooded areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or local media for further statements and updated forecasts. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
